title: Whisperfeet
data:
| \[   Whisperfeet   [![Combat boots.png](/images/1/15/Combat_boots.png)](/wiki/File:Combat_boots.png) |                                                                             |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Base item                                                                                            | [speed boots](/wiki/Speed_boots "Speed boots")                              |
|                                                                                                      |                                                                             |
| Affiliation                                                                                          | - [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral")
- [(Tourist)](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") |
|                                                                                                      |                                                                             |
| When carried                                                                                         | [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck")                                                   |
| When worn                                                                                            | [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth")                                          |
| When invoked                                                                                         | *(none)*                                                                    |
|                                                                                                      |                                                                             |
| Base price                                                                                           | 5000 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                          |
| Weight                                                                                               | [20](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                                 |

**Whisperfeet** is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral"), and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is a pair of [speed boots](/wiki/Speed_boots "Speed boots").

## Generation

In addition to random generation, Whisperfeet is the guaranteed first [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") for [Tourists](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist").

## Description

While carried, Whisperfeet acts as a [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone"). When worn, it also confers [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth") in addition to its other properties, i.e. very fast [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") and any effects intrinsic to their [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Randomized appearance (SLASH'EM)").

## Strategy

Whisperfeet is a decent sacrifice gift for neutral characters, and Tourists in particular may consider them worth hanging around the first altar they come across in order to sacrifice for it. The relatively early Luck and speed can be a powerful aid in combat, and the stealth helps them avoid waking [nymphs](/wiki/Nymph_\(monster_class\) "Nymph (monster class)") and other sleeping monsters, especially given the much more troublesome nymphs that can generate in SLASH'EM and its variants.

However, Whisperfeet is not intelligent and does not resist curses - be sure to re-bless them when necessary even if you have another luck item (e.g., [the Heart of Ahriman](/wiki/The_Heart_of_Ahriman "The Heart of Ahriman") or [the Orb of Fate](/wiki/The_Orb_of_Fate "The Orb of Fate")), since luckstone effects stack. Whisperfeet is also fairly unremarkable as an artifact wish, with stealth being the only hard property to replace: along with the usual guaranteed luckstone in [Mines' End](/wiki/Mines%27_End "Mines' End"), a pair guaranteed speed boots appears in [the Spider Caves](/wiki/The_Spider_Caves "The Spider Caves").

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Update to reflect THEM/Hack'EM"*

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Whisperfeet

From NetHackWiki

When worn stealth

Weight 20

Whisperfeet is an artifact that appears in SLASH'EM, dNetHack, SlashTHEM, and Hack'EM. It is neutral, and its base item is a pair of speed boots.

Generation

In addition to random generation, Whisperfeet is the guaranteed first sacrifice gift for Tourists.

Description

While carried, Whisperfeet acts as a luckstone. When worn, it also confers stealth in addition to its other properties, i.e. very fast speed and any effects intrinsic to their randomized appearance.

Strategy

Whisperfeet is a decent sacrifice gift for neutral characters, and Tourists in particular may consider them worth hanging around the first altar they come across in order to sacrifice for it. The relatively early Luck and speed can be a powerful aid in combat, and the stealth helps them avoid waking nymphs and other sleeping monsters, especially given the much more troublesome nymphs that can generate in SLASH'EM and its variants.

However, Whisperfeet is not intelligent and does not resist curses - be sure to re-bless them when necessary even if you have another luck item (e.g., the Heart of Ahriman or the Orb of Fate), since luckstone effects stack. Whisperfeet is also fairly unremarkable as an artifact wish, with stealth being the only hard property to replace: along with the usual guaranteed luckstone in Mines' End, a pair guaranteed speed boots appears in the Spider Caves.
